title: How to Select the Right Piece of Fabric

steps.headline: For School: ease of care, durability and low cost as in gingham, chambray, broadcloth, gabardine, jersey, serge, flannel and tweed.
For Housework: washability, comfort and sturdiness as in, gingham, chambray and Dacron.
For Sports: durability, comfort and suitability to use as in corduroy, denim, sailcloth, khaki cloth, poplin, flannel, jersey and tweed.
For Lounging: comfort, crease resistance and firmness of weave as in corduroy, jersey, flannel, challis, velveteen, seersucker and quilted fabrics.
For Nightwear: washability and comfort as in batiste, nylon, rayon, broadcloth and flannel.
For Dress: soft, delicate or bright colors, attractive prints or solid colors and pleasing textures as in organdy, batiste, dotted swiss, velveteen,taffeta, crepe and faille

text: For School: ease of care, durability and low cost as in gingham, chambray, broadcloth, gabardine, jersey, serge, flannel and tweed.  For Housework: washability, comfort and sturdiness as in, gingham, chambray and Dacron.  For Sports: durability, comfort and suitability to use as in corduroy, denim, sailcloth, khaki cloth, poplin, flannel, jersey and tweed.  For Lounging: comfort, crease resistance and firmness of weave as in corduroy, jersey, flannel, challis, velveteen, seersucker and quilted fabrics.  For Nightwear: washability and comfort as in batiste, nylon, rayon, broadcloth and flannel.  For Dress: soft, delicate or bright colors, attractive prints or solid colors and pleasing textures as in organdy, batiste, dotted swiss, velveteen,taffeta, crepe and faille
